cssalib package

Submodules

cssalib.dataframes module

cssalib.dataframes.read_df(filename='test.pkl')

Reads a pandas DataFrame from a pickle file.

Parameters:

filename – The name of the pickle file to read from (default: “test.pkl”).

Returns:

The pandas DataFrame read from the pickle file.

Raises:

Any exceptions that occur during the reading process. –

Examples

>>> df = read_df("data.pkl")
cssalib.dataframes.save_df(dataframe, filename='test.pkl')

Saves a pandas DataFrame to a pickle file.

Parameters:

  • dataframe – The pandas DataFrame to be saved.

  • filename – The name of the pickle file (default: “test.pkl”).

Returns:

None

Examples

>>> df = pd.DataFrame({'A': [1, 2, 3], 'B': [4, 5, 6]})
>>> save_df(df, "data.pkl")
cssalib.dataframes.slice_df(self, dataframe, index, number)

Slices a DataFrame based on the specified index and number of rows.

Parameters:

  • dataframe (pandas.DataFrame) – The DataFrame to be sliced.

  • index (int) – The starting index of the slice.

  • number (int) – The number of rows to include in the slice.

Returns:

The sliced DataFrame.

Return type:

pandas.DataFrame

Examples

sliced_df = slice_df(dataframe, 2, 5)

cssalib.misc module

Misc Module

cssalib.misc.extract_domain_from_email(email: str) → str

Extracts the domain name from the given email address.

The email address is split on the ‘@’ symbol, and the part after the ‘@’ is taken as the domain. This is then split on ‘.’ and the last 2 sections are joined back together with ‘.’ to get the domain name.

Parameters:

email (str) – The email address to extract the domain from.

Returns:

The domain name extracted from the email address.

Return type:

str

Raises:

AttributeError – If no ‘@’ symbol is found in the email.

cssalib.misc.leap_years(start_year: int, end_year: int) → list

The function leap_years returns a list of leap years within a specified range of years.

Parameters:

  • start_year (int) – The start_year parameter is the beginning year from which you want to start checking for leap years.

  • end_year (int) – The end_year parameter represents the ending year for the range of years for which you want to find leap years. This function will return a list of leap years between start_year (inclusive) and end_year (exclusive).

Returns:

The function leap_years returns a list of leap years between the start_year (inclusive) and end_year (exclusive) provided as input arguments. The list comprehension checks each year in the range for leap year conditions (divisible by 4 but not by 100 unless also divisible by 400) and includes the year in the list if it meets these conditions.

Return type:

list

cssalib.misc.most_common_element(_list: list)

Returns the most common element in the given list.

Parameters:

_list (list) – A list of elements.

Returns:

The most common element in the list.

Examples

>>> most_common_element([1, 2, 2, 3, 3, 3, 4])
3
cssalib.misc.public_ip() → str

This Python function retrieves and returns the public IP address of the current machine using an external API.

Returns:

The public_ip function returns the public IP address of the current machine by making a request to the “https://api64.ipify.org?format=json” API and extracting the IP address from the JSON response.

cssalib.misc.test()

Prints ‘Test’ and returns ‘Test’.

Returns:

‘Test’

Return type:

str

cssalib.mongo module

class cssalib.mongo.MongoDB(uri)

Bases: object

MongoDB client class for connecting to a MongoDB database.

Provides methods for pinging the server, listing databases and collections, and performing CRUD operations on collections. Designed to be instantiated with a MongoDB connection URI.

list_collections(database_name: str)

Retrieves a list of collection names for a specific database.

Parameters:

database_name (str) – The name of the database to list collections from.

Returns:

A list of collection names in the specified database.

Return type:

list

list_databases()

Retrieves a list of database names from the MongoDB client.

Returns:

A list of database names.

Return type:

list

ping()

Pings the MongoDB deployment to check the connection status.

cssalib.probabilities.cumulative_binomial_probabilities(number_of_trials: int, number_of_successes: int, success_probability: float) → Tuple[float, float, float, float]

Calculates the cumulative binomial probability distribution for the given number of trials, number of successes, and success probability.

Returns the probabilities for X < x, X <= x, X > x, and X >= x, where x is the provided number of successes.

cssalib.probabilities.exact_binomial_probability(number_of_trials: int, number_of_successes: int, success_probability: float) → float

Calculates the exact binomial probability for the given number of trials, number of successes, and success probability.

Parameters:

  • number_of_trials (int) – The number of trials.

  • number_of_successes (int) – The number of successes.

  • success_probability (float) – The probability of success on each trial.

Returns:

The exact binomial probability.

Return type:

float
